title: Level 5 Statistics Practice Test
description: Test your skills with mean, median, probability, and data interpretation at the Level 5 standard.

questions.question: What is the mean of these numbers: $4, 6, 8, 10, 12$?
What is the median of: $3, 7, 1, 9, 5$?
questions.explanation: Order the values: $1, 3, 5, 7, 9$. The middle (3rd) value is $5$.

questions.question: A bag has $2$ red and $8$ blue marbles. What is the probability of picking a red marble?
The probability of an event occurring is $\frac{3}{8}$. What is the probability of it NOT occurring?
Two data sets have the same mean. Data Set A has a range of $4$ and Data Set B has a range of $15$. Which statement is true?

options.text: Data Set A is more spread out
Data Set B is more spread out

questions.explanation: The **range** measures how spread out data is. A larger range ($15 > 4$) means Data Set B is more spread out.

questions.question: A standard die is rolled. What is the probability of rolling a number greater than $4$?
questions.explanation: Numbers greater than $4$: $5$ and $6$ â€” that's $2$ outcomes out of $6$ total. $P = \frac{2}{6} = \frac{1}{3}$.

questions.question: Find the mean of: $15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 45$.
questions.explanation: Sum $= 15 + 20 + 25 + 30 + 35 + 45 = 170$. Number of values $= 6$. Mean $= \frac{170}{6} \approx 28.33$... Wait, let me recalculate: $15 + 20 = 35$, $35 + 25 = 60$, $60 + 30 = 90$, $90 + 35 = 125$, $125 + 45 = 170$. Mean $= \frac{170}{6} = 28.\overline{3}$. Rounded to the nearest whole number, the mean is approximately $28$.

questions.question: Find the median of: $12, 4, 8, 15, 6, 10$.
questions.explanation: Order: $4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 15$. Even number of values ($6$), so the median is the average of the 3rd ($8$) and 4th ($10$) values: $\frac{8 + 10}{2} = 9$.

questions.question: A spinner has $5$ equal sections: $2$ red, $1$ blue, $1$ green, and $1$ yellow. Express the probability of landing on red as a fraction.
questions.explanation: There are $2$ red sections out of $5$ total. $P(\text{red}) = \frac{2}{5}$.

questions.question: Data set: $5, 8, 3, 12, 2$. What is the range?
